QuestionText.Text: A car starts at point A and drives 30 miles due east to point B, then turns 150° counterclockwise and drives to point C, which is due north of point A. How far is point B from point C? Write your answer to the nearest tenth of a mile.
QuestionText.Html: A car starts at point A and drives 30 miles due east to point B, then turns 150° counterclockwise and drives to point C, which is due north of point A. How far is point B from point C? Write your answer to the nearest tenth of a mile.

Feedback.Text:
The correct answer is 34.6. First draw a diagram illustrating the situation:

Use the identity cos(θ)=adjacenthypotenuse:
cos30°=30x
32=30x
3x=60
x=603
≈ 34.6

The correct answer is 34.6. First draw a diagram illustrating the situation:

cos30°=30x{"version":"1.1","math":"<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>30</mn><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>"}

32=30x{"version":"1.1","math":"<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>30</mn><mi>x</mi></mfrac></math>"}

3x=60{"version":"1.1","math":"<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>"}

x=603{"version":"1.1","math":"<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>60</mn><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt></mfrac></math>"}

≈ 34.6
